items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and opposition energy spokesperson Dan Tehan have both arrived home from trips abroad with a spring in their step.

items.title: Organisers refuse offer to move Agnes Water festival off rainbow bee-eater bird nesting site
items.summary: A two-day cultural festival will go ahead this weekend on top of a protected bird's nesting site in Queensland after organisers declined an offer of help to relocate it.

items.title: Indonesia boarding school collapse reflects a 'widespread' building problem
items.summary: An operation to rescue around 60 children trapped under an Islamic boarding school in Indonesia's East Java province has now shifted into a recovery operation, with the death toll expected to significantly rise.

items.title: Max Verstappen has never won the F1 Singapore Grand Prix but has a chance as he chases Oscar Piastri and McLaren
items.summary: Max Verstappen has won the previous two grands prix in Formula 1, but this weekend's race in Singapore is the only circuit on the calendar on which he has never triumphed.

items.title: Players to watch this Sheffield Shield season ahead of Ashes Test summer
items.summary: With Australia's men's Test team largely settled, there are a few key spots that could hang on a handful of Sheffield Shield performances before the start of the Ashes.

items.title: Menindee fish passage trial aimed at preventing mass deaths enters second stage
items.summary: A fish passage that connects the Darling River with Lake Wetherell in order to redistribute native fish is being trialled with the aim of preventing more ecological disasters.

items.title: Jarred Drew Heath pleads guilty after pointing replica gun at police in Gatton caravan park
items.summary: Jarred Drew Heath told police he wished he had a bullet and an "AK" to shoot officers with.

items.title: Afghan women's refugee team return to international football amid calls for more autonomy
items.summary: Australian-based players headline the Afghan women's refugee football team preparing to play for the first time since the Taliban takeover in 2021, but they're still pushing for greater autonomy over their future.

items.title: Appeal for help over body in burnt-out SUV on Kamilaroi Highway near Brewarrina
items.summary: Detectives have a possible identity for a body in a burnt-out station wagon in north-west New South Wales and have appealed for more information.

items.title: Aussie travellers devastated after US government shutdown forces tourist attractions to close
items.summary: Australian travellers heading to the United States are being warned to expect disruptions with some tourist attractions closed, flights disrupted and national parks and museums affected.

items.title: Murder investigation launched after father-of-two Chris Robertson's body found at Lonsdale workshop
items.summary: The death of Chris Robertson, whose body was found at an industrial site in Adelaide's south on Tuesday, is now being treated as a major crime, police say.

items.title: First survey in five years shows feral deer population boom in Tasmania
items.summary: The first survey for feral deer in Tasmania in five years reveals an unanticipated increase of nearly 20,000 to the population.

items.title: China's K visa scheme has some worrying about jobs in a country already facing challenges
items.summary: The new visa is designed to attract top global STEM talent but has sparked fierce backlash, with critics warning it could squeeze Chinese nationals out of the graduate job market.

items.title: Glenelg beach blanketed with foam as Premier announces algal bloom hotline
items.summary: Brown foam has blanketed one of the state's most popular tourist beaches in South Australia, as the state government launches an algal bloom hotline.

items.title: Global financial stability risks have not receded, Reserve Bank warns
items.summary: The Reserve Bank warns risks to the global financial system are "rising", not receding, and Australia is not immune from any fallout.

items.title: Dartbrook Hunter Valley mine to stop running after failed revival
items.summary: The struggling Dartbrook Coal Mine will stop running less than a year after its new operators tried to revive it.

items.title: Review of west coast bushfires finds flaws in Tasmania's firefighting responses
items.summary: A COVID outbreak that "spread quickly" through a cramped fire management headquarters was just one issue faced during the response to Tasmania's west coast fires last summer, a review finds.

items.title: Date set for Townsville mayoral by-election by postal ballot
items.summary: Townsville voters who have been in limbo since their mayor was suspended last year will vote in a by-election to select the city's next civic leader.

items.title: Jane Goodall, who revolutionised our understanding of animals, dies at 91
items.summary: British primatologist Jane Goodall entered the African wilderness at 26, without any formal scientific training or university degree. She emerged with research that forever changed how we understand the animal kingdom.

items.title: Helen Garner shortlisted for Baillie Gifford Prize for collected diaries, How to End a Story
items.summary: This year, Helen Garner has been in Dua Lipa's book club and the SATC spin-off. Now she's in the running for the Baillie Gifford Prize for non-fiction.

items.title: Couple rescued from Cradle Mountain Overland Track sheltered in 'freezing' conditions
items.summary: Two bushwalkers with mild hypothermia have been walked out of Cradle Mountain National Park in Tasmania's central highlands after activating their emergency beacon on Wednesday night.

items.title: Atherton small butcher buys local meatworks to supply beef across the country
items.summary: A Far North Queensland butcher expands his business into an established beef brand, with products sent all over Queensland and interstate.

items.title: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban have split. Here's what couples can expect when separating
items.summary: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban are separating after 19 years of marriage. Separation is common — and here’s what experts say those of us living outside the public eye can expect when going through it.

items.title: Geraldton residents push for public medical imaging amid high costs
items.summary: Residents in WA's Midwest are travelling hundreds of kilometres to avoid costly medical imaging fees. They say it is time that changed.

items.title: Matildas star Mary Fowler continues her Manchester City career with one-year contract extension
items.summary: Mary Fowler praises Manchester City for its support as the Matildas star announces a contract extension.

items.title: Phil Gould hospitalised over heart concerns, Canterbury Bulldogs football boss says 'everything is OK'
items.summary: The Canterbury Bulldogs boss assures fans he is on the mend after being hospitalised when doctors found a problem during routine blood tests.

items.title: NSW EPA blamed for slow contamination warning on Belubula River
items.summary: Documents sought through freedom of information laws show the extent of fish contamination in a NSW river, information an inquiry found the EPA kept from the community for eight months.

items.title: Police find prisoner who went missing from Julia Creek Work Camp
items.summary: A 32-year-old serving a prison sentence for serious assault has been located after going missing in north-west Queensland.

items.title: Top statistician accuses government of spinning rock art science
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Top statistician breaks silence over Murujuga rock art study near Woodside gas plant
items.summary: A scientist who quit a major study on WA rock art is accusing the government of downplaying findings linking damage to heavy industry.

items.title: 'Tomorrow could be the day': Jordan Brunoli from Bugs opens up about terminal cancer fears
items.summary: At 29, Australian musician Jordan Brunoli was diagnosed with incurable cancer. He says he's terrified of what comes next.

items.title: Australia's favourite authors share their top books of the 21st century
items.summary: We asked Australia's favourite authors to share their top books of the 21st century. Here's what they said.

items.title: Police release first picture of Gus as ADF joins the search for missing child
items.summary: Police have released the first image of Gus since his disappearance, with almost 50 members of the Australian Defence Force joining the search for the four-year-old in mid-north South Australia.

items.title: Disability advocates call for rethink after Palmerston Hospital's hydrotherapy pool closes to external providers
items.summary: Robyne Burridge lives with a disability that severely impacts her mobility, and hydrotherapy is vital. But she hasn't received that treatment in months after the NT government cut off public access to the only suitable local facility.

items.title: In winning his second Dally M player of the year award, James Tedesco is defying time itself
items.summary: Roosters fullback James Tedesco held off the challenge of players over a decade his junior to defy time and claim his second Dally M player of the year award.

items.title: Year 7 students build open-source, 3D-printed hand for classmate
items.summary: Lois Agnello was born with only part of her left hand and came up with the idea to use her school's 3D printer to make a new one.

items.title: Police issue warrant for Sydney rapper YC Ewzy, aka Harley Johan, over Niddal Acherkouk shooting
items.summary: Police are looking for a Sydney rapper they believe fled the country after a gangland murder where a man was ambushed and gunned down at an inner-city service station in 2024.

items.title: Adelaide lord mayor confident on being COP31-ready despite hosting decision delays
items.summary: Adelaide's lord mayor is confident the city will be prepared to host the event, even though it is 13 months away and Australia remains in a deadlock over hosting rights.

items.title: Staff shortage limits maternity services at St Vincent's Private Hospital Toowoomba
items.summary: St Vincent's Private Hospital at Toowoomba sets up a hotline for expectant mothers, after temporarily scaling back services at its special care nursery.

items.title: New 124-bed Launceston private hospital a step closer after unanimous council approval for planning change
items.summary: A plan that will enable a state-of-the-art medical facility with 10 operating theatres, a laboratory, pharmacy, helipad and a bridge to Launceston's public hospital is unanimously supported by all Launceston councillors in a vote.

items.title: Family of Indigenous man says NSW government apology for death in custody 'too little, too late'
items.summary: The family of an Indigenous man who died in prison says an apology from Corrective Services NSW has come "too little, too late".

items.title: VPNs, 'old man' masks, and AI: The holes in the social media ban and their fixes
items.summary: From December 10, social media platforms will be forced to block under 16s in Australia from holding accounts, but experts warn age checks can be easily bypassed in several ways, including a $22 "old man" mask.

items.title: The oceans keep score in a year of record heat around Australia
items.summary: For the past year, Australia's oceans have been hotter than ever before. The impacts are being felt all across the nation — as far away from the coast as you can get.

items.title: Calls to reform Australia's pension age as labourers consider early retirement due to injury
items.summary: For some Australians, continuing to work until the pension age of 67 can be a struggle. Peita says a life of heavy lifting has taken its toll on her body, and she is trying to survive on JobSeeker payments.

items.title: Social media and online dating exposes girls to greater risks of child marriage, new report shows
items.summary: Modern technology is allowing girls to choose their own partners but some remain vulnerable to child marriage to escape hardship.

items.title: Jane Goodall, renowned conservationist, dies aged 91
items.summary: The conservationist was renowned for her groundbreaking chimpanzee field research and globe-spanning environmental advocacy.

items.title: The number of large companies paying no tax in Australia has declined, says ATO
items.summary: The proportion of large companies in Australia that paid no tax in the most recent income year has declined from 36 per cent to 28 per cent over the past 11 years.

items.title: Former employees of sunscreen testing lab Princeton Consumer Research blow whistle on alleged questionable practices
items.summary: Two former employees of a leading international testing laboratory used by major Australian sunscreen brands have blown the whistle on alleged questionable data and incorrect testing practices, amid ongoing concerns about whether consumers can trust the products they are relying on for sun protection.

items.title: Should nuclear be part of the energy mix in Australia?
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Dr Marianne Gale appointed new Queensland Chief Health Officer after lengthy search
items.summary: Dr Marianne Gale previously held the high-profile role of NSW deputy chief health officer during the pandemic and will take on the top job in December.

items.title: Ash Gardner century guides Australia to win over New Zealand to start Women's World Cup defence
items.summary: All-rounder Ash Gardner makes a landmark century as Australia kicks off its World Cup defence in India with a comfortable win over New Zealand.

items.title: Cats apologise for 'inappropriate' Mad Monday behaviour, AFL 'not thrilled'
items.summary: Geelong breaks its silence about the club's Mad Monday antics, revealing future post-season events "will not continue in this current form".

items.title: Dally M 2025 red carpet: NRLW and NRL stars dress up for awards night
items.summary: The awards night for the NRL and NRLW gives players the chance to step out in something other than their grass-stained jerseys. So we're expecting big things on the Dally M red carpet in Sydney.

items.title: Dally M Awards 2025: James Tedesco and Tamika Upton win medal for second time
items.summary: Sydney Roosters NRL captain James Tedesco and Brisbane Broncos NRLW fullback Tamika Upton have each created their own slice of history, winning the Dally M Medal for a second time.

items.title: Wagga Wagga horse trader pleads not guilty to running an illegal knackery
items.summary: Wagga Wagga property operator Adrian Talbot has been charged with operating a knackery and "animal food van" business without a licence.

items.title: Woman remains traumatised by police strip search as new commissioner issues apology
items.summary: At just 18 years old, Kristelle would step through the gates of a music festival in Sydney's west and leave feeling like she had been sexually assaulted.

items.title: NT Police seize more than 240 guns from former Kakadu park ranger who captured 5.1m crocodile, Sweetheart
items.summary: A Kakadu National Park firearms dealer faces charges by NT Police for failing to properly store hundreds of guns being kept on a property at the park.

items.title: Inside the search for missing four-year-old boy Gus on isolated SA sheep station
items.summary: Authorities are searching for a missing four-year-old boy on a sheep grazing station in the mid-north of South Australia. Here's what we know about the search so far.

items.title: Tasmanian Devils' AFL draft concessions for 2028 announced
items.summary: Tasmania's fledgling AFL team, the Devils, will have a $5 million signing bonus pool in addition to the salary cap to help lure players from interstate. It's one of the many draft concessions released by the AFL for the team's entry to the national league.

items.title: Australia posts six-wicket win over New Zealand in opening men's T20I
items.summary: The Australian men's team claims a 1-0 series lead after recording a six-wicket win over New Zealand at Tauranga's Bay Oval.

items.title: Former prisoners to stand trial over alleged extortion, murder of inmate Benn Schinkel
items.summary: Two fellow prisoners, who were charged over the 2022 alleged murder and extortion of Benn Schinkel, will stand trial in the Supreme Court in Brisbane over his death.

items.title: Why the NRLW 2025 grand final looms as a defining moment
items.summary: The Roosters and Broncos have both dominated the NRLW, but the winners this weekend can legitimately stamp themselves as the pre-eminent club in the competition.

items.title: SA Police issue warning about fake currency after more than 200 incidents and two arrests in recent months
items.summary: SA Police says there have been more than 200 reported cases of counterfeit currency being used in the state in the past two months.

items.title: Roadworks completed as construction of new Paradise Dam wall sparks environmental concerns
items.summary: More than 53 hectares of bushland and riverine habitat will be cleared for a major upgrade to a regional Queensland dam, prompting environmentalists to raise concerns about protected lungfish and turtles.
